Set up a table observer

Source: R/tables.R
INTERNAL_setup_table_observer.Rd

Set up the actions for an observer for a parameter choice in a plot panel that may involve a linked table.

.setup_table_observer(mode, id, pObjects, rObjects, input, session,
  by_field, title, select_field, tab_field, select_choices,
  param = "color")

Arguments

mode

String specifying the encoded panel type of the current (receiving) plot.
id

Integer scalar specifying the index of the current panel of the specified type.
pObjects

An environment containing table_links, a graph produced by .spawn_table_links; and memory, a list of DataFrames containing parameters for each panel of each type.
rObjects

A reactive list containing incrementable counters for all panels,
input

A Shiny list of inputs, generated by the server.
session

A session object from a Shiny server.
by_field

String specifying the name of the field containing the data source for the current panel.
title

String specifying the title used for table-based data sources, to match to the value of by_field in memory for this plot.
select_field

String specifying the name of the field containing the selected row for this panel.
tab_field

String specifying the name of the field containing the decoded name of the table input for this panel.
select_choices

Vector of consecutive integers indexing all rows, named with the row names.
param

String specifying the type of table link to the current plot, i.e., color or x/y-axis.

Value

A logical scalar indicating whether the current (receiving) plot needs to be regenerated.

Details

This function has a number of side-effects, relying on the pass-by-reference behaviour of pObjects, rObjects and session to perform its role.

  • New values of the fields by_field and tab_field in input overwrite values in pObjects$memory for the current panel.

  • pObjects$table_links is modified for the new linked table in input[[tab_field]]. Note that table links are not destroyed if input[[by_field]] is different to title, as this could result in failure to clear the memory of the current panel in .delete_table_links.

  • Link panel counters in rObjects are incremented if the new linked table differs from the old link table and input[[by_field]]==title; or if input[[by_field]] differs from that in memory and either of them is equal to title. Counters are only updated for the current panel as well as the old/new tables, and only when

  • The selectize UI element corresponding to select_field is updated with the current selection in the linked table, if a new linked table was chosen. Note that this will trigger another call to the observer that contains this function.

The flag to regenerate the current plot is set if the by_field and tab_field fields in input are non-NULL; and the by_field entry differs from the parameter currently stored in memory.

Note that by_field and title are ignored if param="yaxis", as the y-axis of feature/sample assay plots have no other choice of variable.

See also

.modify_table_links, iSEE

Contents

  • Value
